channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As Off Broadway Crews Unionize, Workers See Hope, Producers Peril
item.description: Workers say the move is overdue, but theater companies fear it will drive up costs in a wounded sector that has yet to recover from the pandemic.

item.title: Angela Merkel Is Retired. But She’s Still on the Ballot.
item.description: If anything unites the parties in Germany’s election campaign, it is running away from the former chancellor, whose legacy voters have soured on.

item.title: Nokia picks Intel exec as first U.S.-born CEO as group pivots to AI boom
item.description: Nokia has appointed Intel's AI exec Justin Hogard as it seeks to arrest stagnant revenues.

item.title: Red Lobster’s millennial CEO practices emotional control so his team never sees him sweat
item.description: Red Lobster's millennial CEO Damola Adamolekun said practicing emotional control results in a more positive work environment for his team.

item.description: Chain continues its push to lure back customers.
